q.s: ​The function f is a quartic polynomial of the form fx=ax-r1x-r2x-r3x-r4, where a is a real number and the values of ri are integers. It is known that the x-intercepts of f are -1,0 and 2,0, the y-intercept of f is 0,24, and f has two real zeros each with multiplicity 2. Which of the following statements is true?

o.l: ​There is sufficient information to define fx because the x-intercepts and the multiplicity of zeros can be used to determine the ri values, and the y-intercept can be used to find a.

​There is sufficient information to define fx because the y-intercept value 24 can be factored into the product of at least 4 integers involving the x-intercepts, and the multiplicity of zeros is known.

​There is insufficient information to define fx because although the x-intercepts and the multiplicity of zeros can be used to determine the ri values, the y-intercept can only be used to find a but not the sign of a.

​There is insufficient information to define fx because only two of the x-intercepts are known, and the y-intercept and multiplicity of zeros do not provide enough information to determine the other two values of  ri or the value of a.

q.s:
MRTRT0.80.60.20.4

 

In a certain city, when people choose between paid driving services, they choose between a rideshare service R or a taxi T. The constant ai gives the percent of people in year i who choose R and the constant bi gives the percent of people in year i who choose T. The given matrix M is a 2×2 transition matrix that is used to model changes between choices in successive years such that Manbn=an+1bn+1. This year, the city estimates that 30% of people chose R and 70% chose T. Based on this model, which of the following is the best conclusion?

o.l: Many years later, 6% of people will choose R because det0.80.60.20.4=0.2, and 0.2 times the current 0.3 is 0.06, which indicates the percent of those who will choose R in the steady-state future.
Many years later, 66% of people will choose R because 0.80.60.20.40.30.7=0.660.34, and 0.66 represents the future percent of those who will choose R in the steady-state future.
Many years later, 75% of people will choose R because 0.80.60.20.4k0.30.7=0.750.25 for large values of k, and 0.75 represents the future percent of those who will choose R in the steady-state future.
Many years later, 80% of people will choose R because the 0.8 value in row 1, column 1 of 0.80.60.20.4 indicates the percent of those who will continue to choose R in the steady-state future.

When the pump is running, the rate at which the volume of water in the pool decreases is constant. During the first two hours, the pump works slower than usual due to a broken piece. Then the pump stops working. The broken piece is replaced, and the pump works at its usual rate until the pool is completely emptied of water. The entire process of emptying the pool takes six hours.

The horizontal axis is labeled t. The vertical axis is labeled v of t. Neither axis has a scale or tick marks. Moving from left to right:

Part A

The graph of  h  and its dashed midline for two full cycles is shown. Five points, F, G, J, K, and P, are labeled on the graph. No scale is indicated, and no axes are presented.

Determine possible coordinates t,ht for the five points: F, G, J, K, and P.

5 points are on the graph as follows:

  • Point F is at the first peak.
  • Point G is on the midline between the first peak and the first trough.
  • Point J is at the first trough.
  • Point K is on the midline between the first trough and the second peak.
  • Point P is at the second peak.

f.c:
The figure shows two people turning a jump rope at a constant rate as a third person attempts to jump over the rope as it passes below their feet. Point X is located in the middle of the jump rope and is touching the ground at time  t = 0  seconds. The next time that point X touches the ground is at time t=1 second. The maximum height of X above the ground is 78 inches. As the rope turns, the height of X above the ground periodically increases and decreases.

The sinusoidal function h models the height of point X above the ground, in inches, as a function of time t, in seconds.

q.s:
The parametric function f is given by ft=x1t,y1t, where x1t=cost and y1t=sint for 0≤t≤2π. The parametric function g is given by gt=x2t,y2t, where x2t=cos2t and y2t=sin2t for 0≤t≤2π. 

The graphs of f and g both appear in the xy-plane as unit circles. Which of the following is true about the graphs of f and g ?

o.l: Because the periods of the functions x2t and y2t that define g are half the periods of the functions x1t and y1t that define f, the graph of g traverses the graph of f twice for 0≤t≤2π.
Because the periods of the functions x2t and y2t that define g are twice the periods of the functions x1t and y1t that define f, the graph of g traverses the graph of f twice for 0≤t≤2π.
The periods of the functions x2t and y2t that define g are half the periods of the functions x1t and y1t that define f, and the graph of g traverses the graph of f once for 0≤t≤2π.
The periods of the functions x2t and y2t that define g are twice the periods of the functions x1t and y1t that define f, and the graph of g traverses the graph of f once for 0≤t≤2π.

q.s:
• The figure includes two rays forming an angle and a dashed vertical line segment. There is a note that the figure is not drawn to scale.
  • One ray is horizontal, pointing to the right. The ray is labeled Jody x mph.
  • The second ray has the same starting point as the first ray. The two rays form the angle labeled with a measure of pi over 6. The second ray has the label Charlotte 4 mph.
  • A vertical dashed segment is shown, extending from the horizontal ray to the second ray above it.
  • The intersection of the dashed segment and the horizontal ray is labeled as a right angle.

f.c:
The tire of a car has a radius of  9  inches, and a person rolls the tire forward at a constant rate on level ground, as shown in the figure. Point W on the edge of the tire touches the ground at time  t = 1 2  second. The tire completes a full rotation, and the next time  W  touches the ground is at time  t = 5 2  seconds. The maximum height of W above the ground is 18 inches. As the tire rolls, the height of W above the ground periodically increases and decreases.

The sinusoidal function h models the height of point W above the ground, in inches, as a function of time t, in seconds.

  • For each part of the question, show the work that leads to your answers.

    • The curve begins at the origin and increases to a relative maximum at t equals 4.
    • The curve decreases back to the horizontal axis to reach a relative minimum at t equals 8.
    • The curve increases to a relative maximum at t equals 12. Both relative maxima appear to have the same y coordinate.
    • The curve decreases to reach the horizontal axis at t equals 16.

• The horizontal, or t, axis ranges from 0 to 16 in increments of 1. The y axis shows no tick marks and no scale.
  • Moving from left to right:
    • The curve begins on the positive y axis and decreases to reach a relative minimum on the horizontal axis at t equals 4.
    • The curve increases to reach a relative maximum at t equals 8. This relative maximum and the beginning point of the curve appear to have the same y coordinate.
    • The curve decreases to reach a relative minimum on the horizontal axis at t equals 12.
    • The curve increases to its ending point at t equals 16. The y coordinate of this point appears to be equal to the y coordinate of the beginning point.

• The horizontal, or t, axis ranges from 0 to 16 in increments of 1. The y axis shows no tick marks and no scale.
  • Moving from left to right:
    • The curve begins at the origin.
    • The curve increases to t equals 4 at a less steep rate, and becomes nearly horizontal at t equals 4.
    • The curve increases from t equals 4 to t equals 8.
    • The curve increases from t equals 8 to t equals 12 at a less steep rate, and becomes nearly horizontal at t equals 12.
    • The curve increases from t equals 12 to t equals 16, at which point it ends.

• The horizontal, or t, axis ranges from 0 to 16 in increments of 1. The y axis shows no tick marks and no scale.

    • The curve begins at the origin.

o.l: ​The least interval of time is the period of the function, which is ​1{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} second, because the coefficient of t{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} is π{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} and the period is π{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} divided by this coefficient.

The least interval of time is the period of the function, which is ​2{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} seconds, because the coefficient of t{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} is π{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} and the period is 2π{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} divided by this coefficient.

​The least interval of time is the period of the function, which is ​π{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} seconds, because the coefficient of t{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} is π{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} and the period is that coefficient.

​​The least interval of time is the period of the function, which is ​2π{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} seconds, because the coefficient of t{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} is π{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} and the period is 2{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} times that coefficient.

q.s:
Part A

(i) ​​Use the given data to write two equations that can be used to find the values for constants  a  and  b  in the expression for  G t .

(ii) Find the values for  a  and  b  as a decimal approximation.

f.c:
On the initial day of sales ( t = 0 ) for a new video game, there were 40 thousand units of the game sold that day. Ninety-one days later (t=91), there were 76 thousand units of the game sold that day. 

The number of units of the video game sold on a given day can be modeled by the function G given by Gt=a+blnt+1, where Gt is the number of units sold, in thousands, on day t since the initial day of sales.

q.s:
Part B

(i) ​Use the given data to find the average rate of change of the number of units of the video game sold, in thousands per day, from  t = 0  to  t = 91  days. Express your answer as a decimal approximation. Show the computations that lead to your answer.

(ii) Use the average rate of change found in (i) to estimate the number of units of the video game sold, in thousands, on day  t = 50 . Show the work that leads to your answer.

(iii) Let  A t  represent the estimate of the number of units of the video game sold, in thousands, using the average rate of change found in (i). For  A 50 , found in (ii), it can be shown that  A 50 < G 50 . Explain why, in general,  A t < G t  for all  t , where  0 < t < 91 .

f.c:
On the initial day of sales ( t = 0 ) for a new video game, there were 40 thousand units of the game sold that day. Ninety-one days later (t=91), there were 76 thousand units of the game sold that day. 

The number of units of the video game sold on a given day can be modeled by the function G given by Gt=a+blnt+1, where Gt is the number of units sold, in thousands, on day t since the initial day of sales.

q.s:
Part C

The makers of the video game reported that daily sales of the video game decreased each day after  t = 91 . Explain why the error in the model  G  increases after  t = 91 .

f.c:
On the initial day of sales ( t = 0 ) for a new video game, there were 40 thousand units of the game sold that day. Ninety-one days later (t=91), there were 76 thousand units of the game sold that day. 

The number of units of the video game sold on a given day can be modeled by the function G given by Gt=a+blnt+1, where Gt is the number of units sold, in thousands, on day t since the initial day of sales.

The tetrahedral numbers similarly specify the number of spheres needed to create a tetrahedron, which is a triangular-based pyramid. The tetrahedral numbers are 1, 4, 10, 20, 35, 56, 84, etc. Which of the following statements is true?

​The tetrahedral numbers are best modeled by a cubic function because the 3rd{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} differences are a nonzero constant.

f.c:
Directions:

  • Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function f is assumed to be the set of all real numbers x for which  f x  is a real number. Angle measures for trigonometric functions are assumed to be in radians.
  • Solutions to equations must be real numbers. Determine the exact value of any expression that can be obtained without a calculator. For example, log28, cosπ2, and  sin - 1 1  can be evaluated without a calculator.
  • Unless otherwise specified, combine terms using algebraic methods and rules for exponents and logarithms, where applicable. For example, 2x+3x, 52·53,  x 5 x 2 , and ln3+ln5 should be rewritten in equivalent forms.
  • For each part of the question, show the work that leads to your answers.

q.s: ​An open-top box is constructed by cutting squares that are x inches by x inches from the corners of an 11.2-inch by 13.3-inch rectangular piece of cardboard, and then folding the sides of the box up to make walls. The volume of the box is modeled by the function V given by Vx=4x3-49x2+148.96x. Which of the following statements is true about the function V ?

o.l: ​​The contextual situation restricts the domain of V to 0<x<13.3, and the relative maximum value of V on this domain is 2724.106. This is because the longer side of the cardboard determines the domain restriction.

​The contextual situation restricts the domain of V to 0<x<11.2, and the relative maximum value of V on this domain is 1141.504. This is because the shorter side of the cardboard determines the domain restriction.

​​​The contextual situation restricts the domain of V to 0<x<6.65, and the relative maximum value of V on this domain is 133.929. This is because half of the longer side of the cardboard determines the domain restriction.

​​The contextual situation restricts the domain of V to 0<x<5.6, and the relative maximum value of V on this domain is 133.929. This is because half of the shorter side of the cardboard determines the domain restriction.

q.s:
Part A

(i)Use the given data to write two equations that can be used to find the values for constants  a  and b in the expression for Ft.

(ii)Find the values for a and b as decimal approximations.

f.c:
Each spring a particular species of fish migrates up a river. “Migrates” refers to moving from one region to another according to the seasons. In 2015 (t=0), there were  4500  fish that migrated up the river. In 2021 (t=6), there were 900 fish that migrated up the river.  

For t≥0, the number of fish that migrated up the river can be modeled by the function F given by Ft=abt, where Ft is the number of fish that migrated up the river in year t, and t is the number of years since 2015.

q.s:
Part B

(i) Use the given data to find the average rate of change of the number of fish that migrated up the river, in fish per year, from t=0 to t=6 years. Express your answer as a decimal approximation. Show the computations that lead to your answer.

(ii) Use the average rate of change found in (i) to estimate the number of fish that migrated up the river in 2017 (t=2). Show the work that leads to your answer.

(iii) Let At represent the estimate of the number of fish that migrated up the river using the average rate of change found in (i). For A2, found in (ii), it can be shown that A2>F2. Explain why, in general,  A t > F t  for all t, where 0<t<6.

f.c:
Each spring a particular species of fish migrates up a river. “Migrates” refers to moving from one region to another according to the seasons. In 2015 (t=0), there were  4500  fish that migrated up the river. In 2021 (t=6), there were 900 fish that migrated up the river.  

For t≥0, the number of fish that migrated up the river can be modeled by the function F given by Ft=abt, where Ft is the number of fish that migrated up the river in year t, and t is the number of years since 2015.

    • The loop on the right has symmetry over the polar axis.
    • The loop on the left is a reflection of the loop on the right over the vertical axis.
  • Two of the loops, top and bottom, have a vertical orientation.
    • The loop on the top moves from the origin, upward and to the right, passing radii of 1 and 2, to a maximum distance from the vertical axis.
    • From the maximum distance from the vertical axis, the loop on the top moves upward and to the left, passing through radius of 3, until it reaches the radius of 4.
    • The loop on the top has symmetry over the vertical axis.
    • The loop on the bottom is a reflection of the loop on the top over the polar axis.
  • The four other labeled points are located as follows, clockwise from left to right.
    • A is on the polar axis, on the left loop, and on the radius of 4.
    • B is on the vertical axis, on the top loop, and on the radius of 4.
    • C is on the polar axis, on the right loop, and on the radius of 4.
    • D is on the vertical axis, on the bottom loop, and on the radius of 4.

q.s: The function k is given by kx=2secx on the interval 0,2π. Which of the following describes the asymptotes of the graph of k in the xy-plane?

o.l: The graph of k has vertical asymptotes at x=0, x=π, and x=2π because the graph of y=sinx has x-intercepts at x=0, x=π, and x=2π.
The graph of k has vertical asymptotes at x=π2 and x=3π2 because the graph of y=cosx has x-intercepts at x=π2 and x=3π2.
The graph of k has vertical asymptotes at x=0, x=π, and x=2π because the graph of y=cosx has x-intercepts at x=0, x=π, and x=2π.
The graph of k has vertical asymptotes at x=π2 and x=3π2 because the graph of y=sinx has x-intercepts at x=π2 and x=3π2.

o.l: ​The claim is true because sine and arcsine are inverse functions.
​The claim is true because both sinx=ba{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} and x=arcsinba{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} have infinitely many solutions that are identical.
​The claim is false because if a<0{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} and b<0{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}, then ba>0{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}.
​The claim is false because sinx=ba{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} has infinitely many solutions, but x=arcsinba{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} has only one solution.

  • The U-shaped curves that open up each have a minimum value of y equals 2 midway between the corresponding vertical lines.
  • The U-shaped curves that open down each have a maximum value at y equals negative 2 midway between the corresponding vertical lines.
  • The open up curves occur between x equals negative 7.5 and negative 4.5, then again between x equals negative 1.5 and 1.5, then again between x equals 4.5 and 7.5, and the open down curves occur in the alternate intervals.

• All coordinates are approximate.
  • The U-shaped curves appear to be asymptotic to the dashed vertical lines and alternate between open up and open down between consecutive pairs of dashed vertical lines.
  • The dashed vertical lines occur every 1.5 units at x equals negative 0.75 and positive 0.75 and every 1.5 units in both the positive x and negative x directions.
  • The U-shaped curves that open up each have a minimum value of y equals 2 midway between the corresponding vertical lines.
  • The U-shaped curves that open down each have a maximum value at y equals negative 2 midway between the corresponding vertical lines.
  • One open up curve occurs between x equals 0.75 and 0.75. Open up and open down curves alternate between consecutive pairs of dashed vertical lines in the positive x and negative x directions.

  • The U-shaped curves that open up each have a minimum value of y equals 2 midway between the corresponding vertical lines.
  • The U-shaped curves that open down each have a maximum value at y equals negative 2 midway between the corresponding vertical lines.
  • The open up curves occur between x equals negative 6 and negative 3, then again between x equals 0 and 3, then again between x equals 6 and 9, and the open down curves occur in the alternate intervals.

• All coordinates are approximate.

q.s: At a certain high school, students are required to study Spanish or French during each of their four years in high school. Students may switch languages between school years but must take the next appropriate level in that language. Past data have shown that among year-one, year-two, and year-three students, those who study Spanish in a given year switch to French 20% of the time, and those who study French in a given year switch to Spanish 40% of the time. In a given year, there are a total of 257 year-one, year-two, and year-three students studying Spanish and a total of 337 year-one, year-two, and year-three students studying French. Which of the following best approximates the total number of these students studying each language the following year?

o.l: 0.80.40.20.6257337
0.20.60.80.4257337
0.40.80.60.2257337
0.60.20.40.8257337

Students who completed a class participated in a year-long study to see how much content from the class they retained over the following year. At the end of the class, students completed an initial test to determine the group’s content knowledge. After \(3\) months ( t=3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadshacqGH9aqpcaaIZaaaaa@3905@ ), the group’s score was \(70.84\) points.

q.s:
Part A

The graph of \(h\) and its dashed midline for two full cycles is shown. Five points, \(F\), \(G\), \(J\), \(K\), and \(P\), are labeled on the graph. No scale is indicated, and no axes are presented.
Determine possible coordinates (t,h(t)) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C8A@ for the five points:  \(F\), \(G\), \(J\), \(K\), and \(P\) .

Moving from left to right:
  • Point F is at a maximum point.
  • Point G is on the midline.
  • Point J is at a minimum point.
  • Point K is on the midline.
  • Point P is at a maximum point.

f.c:
The blades of an electric fan rotate in a clockwise direction and complete \(5\) rotations every second. Point \(B\) is on the tip of one of the fan blades and is located directly above the center of the fan at time t=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadshacqGH9aqpcaaIWaaaaa@3902@ seconds, as indicated in the figure. Point \(B\) is \(6\) inches from the center of the fan. The center of the fan is \(20\) inches above a level table on which the fan sits. As the fan blades rotate at a constant speed, the distance between \(B\) and the surface of the table periodically decreases and increases.

The sinusoidal function \(h\) models the distance between \(B\) and the surface of the table, in inches, as a function of time \(t\), in seconds.

q.s:
Part B

The function \(h\) can be written in the form h (t)=asin(b(t+c))+d MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4804@ . Find values of constants \(a\), \(b\), \(c\), and \(d\).

  1. \(h\) is positive and increasing.
  2. \(h\) is positive and decreasing.
  3. \(h\) is negative and increasing.
  4. \(h\) is negative and decreasing.

f.c:
The blades of an electric fan rotate in a clockwise direction and complete \(5\) rotations every second. Point \(B\) is on the tip of one of the fan blades and is located directly above the center of the fan at time t=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadshacqGH9aqpcaaIWaaaaa@3902@ seconds, as indicated in the figure. Point \(B\) is \(6\) inches from the center of the fan. The center of the fan is \(20\) inches above a level table on which the fan sits. As the fan blades rotate at a constant speed, the distance between \(B\) and the surface of the table periodically decreases and increases.

The sinusoidal function \(h\) models the distance between \(B\) and the surface of the table, in inches, as a function of time \(t\), in seconds.

f.c:
The planet Venus orbits the Sun every 225 days. Because of its elliptical orbit, the distance between Venus and the Sun periodically increases and decreases. The maximum distance of Venus from the Sun is 108.9 million kilometers, and the minimum distance of Venus from the Sun is 107.5 million kilometers. The planet reaches each of its maximum distance and minimum distance from the Sun once every 225 days.

The sinusoidal function D , given by D ( t ) = a cos ( b t ) + c MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44D7@ , models the distance, in millions of kilometers, between Venus and the Sun as a function of time t , in days. Based on the function D , Venus is at its maximum distance from the Sun at time t = 0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadshacqGH9aqpcaaIWaaaaa@3902@ days.

q.s:

Let [ t 1 , t 2 ] MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CC0@ represent the time interval between when Venus is at its maximum distance from the Sun and when Venus is at its minimum distance from the Sun.

(i) Use the given data to find the average rate of change of the distance, in millions of kilometers per day, over the time interval [ t 1 , t 2 ] MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CC0@ . Express your answer as a decimal approximation. Show the computations that lead to your answer.

(ii) Interpret the meaning of your answer from (i) in the context of the problem.

Show the work that leads to your answer.

Part A

Determine possible coordinates ( t , h ( t ) ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C87@ for the five points:   F , G , J , K , and P  .

  • Moving from left to right:

    • Point G is on the midline.
    • Point J is at a minimum point.

    • Point P is at a maximum point.

f.c:
The blades of a windmill rotate in a clockwise direction and complete one rotation every 6 seconds. Point B is on the tip of one of the windmill blades and is located directly above the center of the windmill at time t = 0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadshacqGH9aqpcaaIWaaaaa@3901@ seconds, as indicated in the figure. Point B is 40 meters from the center of the windmill. The center of the windmill is 75 meters above the level ground. As the windmill blades rotate at a constant speed, the distance between B and the ground periodically decreases and increases.

The sinusoidal function h models the distance between B and the ground, in meters, as a function of time t , in seconds.

​​The value of a must be negative, because as x increases without bound or decreases without bound, the end behaviors of f are different.
​The value of b must be even, because as x increases without bound or decreases without bound, the end behaviors of f are the same.
​​The value of b must be odd, because as x increases without bound or decreases without bound, the end behaviors of f are different.

q.s: ​Researchers are developing a mathematical function model H to estimate the height of any tree, in meters, based on the tree’s circumference c, in meters, as measured at a height of one meter from base of the tree. Which of the following statements is an assumption about what is consistent in this context?

o.l: ​Because the model applies to trees in general, trees should simultaneously grow in circumference and height across different tree species.
​Because the model should be used across different geographical environments, the domain of the function is limited by environmental factors.
​Because the model should be used across different geographical environments, the range of the function is limited by atmospheric conditions.
​Because the model should be as consistent as possible, the model must be limited to a single tree species to be valuable.

Part A

gx=ex+3

(ii) Solve hx=π4 for values of x in the domain of h.

f.c:
Directions:

  • Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function  f  is assumed to be the set of all real numbers x for which fx is a real number. Angle measures for trigonometric functions are assumed to be in radians.
  • Solutions to equations must be real numbers. Determine the exact value of any expression that can be obtained without a calculator. For example, log28, cosπ2, and  sin - 1 1  can be evaluated without a calculator.
  • Unless otherwise specified, combine terms using algebraic methods and rules for exponents and logarithms, where applicable. For example, 2x+3x, 52·53, x5x2, and ln3+ln5 should be rewritten in equivalent forms.
  • For each part of the question, show the work that leads to your answers.

The average rate of change of W for 10≤t≤15 is less than the average rate of change of W for 5≤t≤10.
The average rate of change of W for 15≤t≤20 is greater than the average rate of change of W for 10≤t≤15.
The average rate of change of W for 21≤t≤22 is less than the average rate of change of W for 20≤t≤21.

q.s:
The stage is shown at the top left. Three squares indicate the sizes of three square-shaped field. The three squares are nested from smallest to largest, share a point in the top left corner, and share a portion of the top of the square and the left side of the square. The smallest square has a horizontal side labeled Small Field. The square that is larger has a horizontal side labeled Medium Field. The largest square has a horizontal side labeled Large Field.

​A music agent is planning a series of concerts at local farms around the nation. The agent is building a model to estimate crowd capacity based on different sizes of square fields. Which type of function is most likely to model crowd capacity in this situation?

o.l: ​Linear
​Piecewise linear
​Quadratic
​Cubic

q.s: Which of the following could be an expression for  h t  ?

o.l: 3sinπ2t
3sinπt
sinπ2t+3
sinπt+3

f.c: The height of a point on a dolphin swimming in the ocean can be modeled by a sinusoidal function h. For time t, in seconds, if ht is positive, the point on the dolphin is above the surface of the water, and if ht is negative, the point on the dolphin is below the surface of the water. As the dolphin swims, it jumps to a maximum height of 3 feet above the surface, then hits the surface, and dives to a minimum height of 3 feet below the surface. The dolphin then returns to the surface, and jumps to a maximum height of 3 feet above the surface. This cycle from maximum height to the next maximum height repeats every  4  seconds.

q.s: ​The function f is defined for all real values of x. For a constant a, the average rate of change of f from x=a to x=a+1 is given by the expression 2a+1. Which of the following statements is true?

o.l: ​The average rate of change of f over consecutive equal-length input-value intervals is positive, so the graph of f could be a line with a positive slope.
​The average rate of change of f over consecutive equal-length input-value intervals is positive, so the graph of f could be a parabola that opens up.
​The average rate of change of f over consecutive equal-length input-value intervals is increasing at a constant rate, so the graph of f could be a line with a positive slope.
​The average rate of change of f over consecutive equal-length input-value intervals is increasing at a constant rate, so the graph of f could be a parabola that opens up.

q.s: ​The rational function r is given by rx=2x-3x-4x-23x-12x+1x-1 and is equivalent to rx=pxqx, where p and q are polynomial functions. Which of the following statements is true?

o.l: ​The degree of p is less than the degree of q, and limx→∞rx=0.
​The degree of p is greater than the degree of q, and limx→∞rx=∞.
​The degree of p is equal to the degree of q, and limx→∞rx=0.
​The degree of p is equal to the degree of q, and limx→∞rx=13.

The linear transformation is a rotation by 2π3 radians counterclockwise about the origin.
The linear transformation is a rotation by 5π6 radians counterclockwise about the origin.

q.s: Which of the following is the graph of the polar function r=fθ{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}, where fθ=2cos2θ{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}, in the polar coordinate system for -π2≤θ≤π2{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} ?

o.l:
​

  • The curve consists of four congruent loops that meet at the origin, each with a maximum radius of 2.
  • The first loop is symmetric over the positive x axis. It runs from the origin, up to the right, then down to the right to (r comma theta) equals (2 comma 0). The loop continues down to the left, then up to the left back to the origin.
  • The second loop is symmetric over the positive y axis. It runs from the origin, up to the left, then up to the right to (r comma theta) equals (2 comma pi over 2). The loop continues down to the right, then down to the left back to the origin.
  • The third loop is symmetric over the negative x axis. It runs from the origin, up to the left, then down to the left to (r comma theta) equals (2 comma pi). The loop continues down to the right, then up to the right back to the origin.
  • The fourth loop is symmetric over the negative y axis. It runs from the origin, down to the left, then down to the right to (r comma theta) equals (2 comma 3 pi over 2). The loop continues up to the right, then up to the left back to the origin.

• The curve consists one full loop and two half loops that meet at the origin, each with a maximum radius of 2.
  • The full loop is symmetric over the positive x axis. It runs from the origin, up to the right, then down to the right to (r comma theta) equals (2 comma 0). The loop continues down to the left, then up to the left back to the origin.
  • The first half loop runs from the origin, up to the left, then up to the right to (r comma theta) equals (2 comma pi over 2).
  • The second half loop runs from the origin, down to the left, then down to the right to (r comma theta) equals (2 comma 3 pi over 2).

​​

  • The curve consists one full loop and two half loops that meet at the origin, each with a maximum radius of 2.
  • The full loop is symmetric over the negative x axis. It runs from the origin, up to the left, then down to the left to (r comma theta) equals (2 comma pi). The loop continues down to the right, then up to the right back to the origin.
  • The first half loop runs from the origin, up to the right, then up to the left to (r comma theta) equals (2 comma pi over 2).
  • The second half loop runs from the origin, down to the right, then down to the left to (r comma theta) equals (2 comma 3 pi over 2).

• The curve consists one full loop and two half loops that meet at the origin, each with a maximum radius of 2.
  • The full loop is symmetric over the negative y axis. It runs from the origin, down to the left, then down to the right to (r comma theta) equals (2 comma 3 pi over 2). The loop continues up to the right, then up to the left back to the origin.
  • The first half loop runs from the origin, up to the right, then down to the right to (r comma theta) equals (2 comma 0). 
  • The second half loop runs from the origin, up to the left, then down to the left to (r comma theta) equals (2 comma pi).

q.s:
The horizontal axis is labeled Day and ranges from 0 to 8 in increments of 1. The vertical axis is labeled Change in Hundreds of Cookies from Previous Day and ranges from negative 4 to 7 in increments of 1. The graph consists of 8 plotted points with the following coordinates:

  • (1 comma 6)
  • (2 comma 5)
  • (3 comma 3)
  • (4 comma 1)
  • (5 comma 0)
  • (6 comma negative 1)
  • (7 comma negative 3)
  • (8 comma negative 4)

​At a bakery, the number of cookies baked each day changes based on anticipated demand. The scatterplot shows the change in hundreds of cookies baked from the previous day for eight days. The point at 2,5 means that on day 2, the number of cookies baked will be 500 more than the number of cookies baked on day 1. A function model C is to be constructed for the number of cookies baked on each of the days, 0 through 8. Which of the following statements best supports the selection of a model for C ?

o.l: Because the information about rate of change is roughly linear, a linear model is best for C.
Because the information about rate of change is roughly linear, a quadratic model is best for C.
​Because the information about rate of change is positive and negative, a quadratic model is best for C.
Because the information about rate of change is positive and negative, a piecewise-linear model is best for C.

o.l:
The horizontal axis is labeled Time and the vertical axis is labeled Distance. 

  • Neither axis has tick marks or a scale.

  • Each section is symmetric about the vertical line through the peak. 
  • The first section begins at the origin, and the sections are connected with no gaps.

The horizontal axis is labeled Time and the vertical axis is labeled Distance.

  • Neither axis has tick marks or a scale.
  • The curve begins at the origin.

q.s: ​The functions g and f are given by gx=3x2-2x and fx=6x4+5x3+3x-5. Which of the following statements is true about the remainder when fx is divided by gx ?

o.l: ​The remainder is 0, so gx is a factor of fx.

q.s: ​Which of the following names a function with a hole in its graph at x=1 and provides correct reasoning related to the hole?

o.l: The graph of ​fx=x2-1x-1 has a hole at 1,2 because the values of x2-1x-1 get arbitrarily close to 2 for x-values sufficiently close to 1, but the function is undefined at x=1.
The graph of ​gx=x2+1x-1 has a hole at x=1 because the values of x2+1x-1 increase without bound for x-values arbitrarily close to 1.
The graph of hx=4x-4x2+1 has a hole at 1,0 because the values of 4x-4x2+1 are arbitrarily close to 0 for x-values sufficiently close to 1.
The graph of kx=4x-4x-12 has a hole at x=1 because the values of 4x-4 and x-12 are arbitrarily close to 0 for x-values sufficiently close to 1.

​During a month in a certain town, the temperature increases and decreases over the course of a day. A graph of the average temperatures during that month for any given day is shown. The data in the graph can be modeled by the function T, where Th gives the temperature, in degrees Fahrenheit (°F{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}), at time h hours after midnight. At a certain point in that month, there is an adjustment to clocks for daylight saving time, at which point clocks are adjusted 1 hour forward. For example, 6 a.m. instantly becomes 7 a.m. The function D models the same data as function T, after the shift to daylight saving time. If h still represents the number of hours after midnight, which of the following defines Dh in terms of T ?

o.l: ​Dh=Th+1
​Dh=Th-1
​Dh=Th+1
​Dh=Th-1

q.s:
• The diagram shows two states, labeled 1 and 2.
  • A loop from state 1 pointing back to state 1 is labeled 0.5.
  • An arrow from state 1 to state 2 is labeled 0.5.
  • A loop from state 2 pointing back to state 2 is labeled 0.5.
  • An arrow from state 2 to state 1 is labeled 0.5.

Objects in a system can be in two possible states: state 1 and state 2. The state transition diagram for this situation is given. Which of the following is true?

o.l: 50% of objects are remaining and leaving both state 1 and state 2. Therefore, this system cannot approach a steady state.

50% of objects are remaining and leaving both state 1 and state 2. Therefore, if the initial percent of objects in state 1 is x%, and the initial percent of objects in state 2 is y%, then the steady state of state 1 is x%, and the steady state of state 2 is y%. The percentages will never change from state 1 being x% and state 2 being y%.

50% of objects are remaining and leaving both state 1 and state 2. Therefore, if the initial percent of objects in state 1 is x%, and the initial percent of objects in state 2 is y%, then the steady state of state 1 is x%, and the steady state of state 2 is y%—even though the percentages may change on the way to a steady state.

50% of objects are remaining and leaving both state 1 and state 2. Therefore, no matter the initial percent of objects in state 1 and the initial percent of objects in state 2, the steady state of state 1 is 50% and the steady state of state 2 is 50%.

q.s:
The temperature of a hot object that is cooling can be modeled by the function h. Time t is measured in minutes since the object started cooling, and ht is measured in degrees Celsius (°C). The function h is an exponential decay function. 
 

It is known that the temperature of the object decreases 10°C from time t=4 to t=7 minutes. It is also known that after time t=7 minutes, the temperature of the object decreases an additional 10°C. Which of the following statements is true about the amount of time the object will require to cool that additional 10°C ?

o.l: The object will require more than 3 minutes to cool that additional 10°C because as t increases, the rates of change of h are negative and increasing toward 0.
The object will require more than 3 minutes to cool that additional 10°C because as t increases, the rates of change of h are negative and decreasing without bound.
The object will require fewer than 3 minutes to cool that additional 10°C because as t increases, the rates of change of h are negative and increasing toward 0.
The object will require fewer than 3 minutes to cool that additional 10°C because as t increases, the rates of change of h are negative and decreasing without bound.

The vertical asymptote of the graph of g is shifted 2 units to the left of the vertical asymptote of the graph of f.

q.s: In the xy-plane, the position of a particle at time t is given by the parametric function f defined by ft=xt,yt for t≥0. Both x and y are polynomial functions and y5-y35-3x5-x35-3=4. Which of the following is true about the slope of the segment connecting the two points on the graph of f for times t=3 and t=5 ?

o.l: The slope of the segment is 2 because y5-y35-3x5-x35-3 gives the ratio of the average rate of change of y with respect to t and the average rate of change of x with respect to t, which needs to be divided by 5-3=2 to get the average rate of change of y with respect to x.

The slope of the segment is 4 because y5-y35-3x5-x35-3 gives the ratio of the average rate of change of y with respect to t and the average rate of change of x with respect to t, which is equivalent to the average rate of change of y with respect to x.

The slope of the segment is 8 because y5-y35-3x5-x35-3 gives the ratio of the average rate of change of y with respect to t and the average rate of change of x with respect to t, which needs to be multiplied by 5-3=2 to get the average rate of change of y with respect to x.

The slope of the segment cannot be determined because y5-y35-3x5-x35-3 does not provide the position of the particle at times t=3 and t=5, but rather only relative rates of yt and xt at times t=3 and t=5.

There is a hole at x=2 only because the multiplicity of -1 in the numerator is equal to the multiplicity of -1 in the denominator, and because the multiplicity of 2 in the numerator is equal to the multiplicity of 2 in the denominator.

q.s: ​Water is poured into an empty vase at a constant rate. A graph (not shown) models the depth of the water in the vase over time. o.l:
• From the circular base, the sides curve inward gradually to form a narrow point near the vertical middle of the solid.
  • Then the sides curve outward in the same manner to end at the top, which has a base approximately the same size as the bottom.

​

  • From the circular base, the sides curve inward and form the narrowest section before curving outward slightly to end at the top.
  • The circular base of the top is smaller than the circular base of the bottom.

• From the circular base, the sides curve outward and then back inward.
  • The circular cross section of the inward curve is smaller than the circle of the base.
  • The sides then curve slightly outward before reaching the top.

• From the circular base, the sides curve outward gradually and then back inward more sharply.
  • The inward curve creates a narrow section with a circular cross section that is smaller than the circular base.
  • The sides then curve outward slightly to reach the top.

Part A

(i) Use the given data to write two equations that can be used to find the values for constants  a  and  b  in the expression for  M t .

(ii) Find the values for  a  and  b  as decimal approximations.

f.c:
A student won $500 in an art contest. At first, the student kept the money in a desk. After 10 months, the student deposited the money in a savings account that earned interest. Six months after depositing the money (t=6), the amount in the account is $508.67. Twelve months after depositing the money (t=12), the amount in the account is $517.50.

The amount of money the student has can be modeled by the piecewise function M given by

           M t = 500 for   - 10 ≤ t < 0 a b t / 12 for   t ≥ 0 ,

where Mt is the amount, in dollars, at time t months since the  $ 500  was deposited into the savings account. A negative value for t represents the number of months before the student deposited the $500 into the savings account.

q.s: Which of the following statements gives the multiplicity of the zero at  C  with correct reasoning?

The particle is moving to the right on the intervals 0<t<1 and 4.142<t<2π, because on these intervals, xt is increasing.
The particle is moving to the right on the intervals 0<t<2.571 and 5.712<t<2π, because on these intervals, xt is positive.

f.c:
• The robotic arm is rectangular in shape and is labeled Arm.
  • The arm is attached to a circular piece that allows the arm to rotate in a counterclockwise, circular motion.
  • Attached to the circular piece is a rectangular base that extends to the level surface.
  • There are several labels in the figure.
    • Point S is on the tip of the Arm.
    • Point X is on the base.
    • The Counterclockwise rotation direction for the Arm is indicated with a dashed circle.
    • The vertical distance between point X and point S is labeled Height Above X.
    • The vertical distance from point X to the highest point on the dashed circle, located above X, is 20.
    • The vertical distance from point X to the lowest point on the dashed circle, located below X, is negative 6.
  • Note that the figure is not drawn to scale.

The figure shows a robotic arm rotating in a circular counterclockwise direction that completes one rotation every 2 seconds. Point S is on the tip of the arm, and point X does not move. As the arm rotates at a constant speed, the height of S above X periodically increases and decreases. At time t=0 seconds, S is at its lowest position, 6 inches directly below X. At its highest position, S is 20 inches directly above X. 

The sinusoidal function  h  models the height of  S  above X, in inches, as a function of time  t , in seconds. A positive value of  h t  indicates S is above X; a negative value of ht indicates S is below X.

q.s: ​A balanced coin with one side heads (H) and the other side tails (T) is repeatedly flipped, and the results are recorded. The coefficients in the expansion of H+Tn give the number of ways to get a particular combination of heads and tails for n flips of the coin. For example, in the expansion of H+T7, the term 21H2T5 means there are 21 ways to get exactly 2 heads and 5 tails when flipping a coin 7 times. How many ways are there to get exactly 2 heads and 4 tails when flipping a balanced coin 6 times?

o.l: ​6
​15
​20
​48

f.c:
• The metronome is a chunky, triangular pyramid-shaped device with a pendulum that moves back and forth from right to left, which is indicated by a curved arrow at the top of the figure.
  • The centerline is vertical and is in the middle of the metronome with markings.
  • The pendulum is a thin rod that forms an angle with the centerline as it moves back and forth from right to left.
  • The angle formed is labeled h of t.
  • Note that the figure is not drawn to scale.

A metronome is a device used to help musicians play music at a particular speed. The metronome has a vertical centerline, as shown in the figure. A pendulum on the metronome swings back and forth as it passes the vertical centerline. When the pendulum is farthest to the left or farthest to the right, the measure of the angle formed by the pendulum and the vertical centerline is 0.5 radian.

At time t=0 seconds, the pendulum is farthest to the left. The pendulum then swings to the right and passes the vertical centerline. At time t=2 seconds, the pendulum is farthest to the right for the first time. Then, the pendulum swings left, passes the vertical centerline, and is farthest to the left again at time t=4 seconds. As the pendulum swings, the measure of the angle formed by the pendulum and the vertical centerline periodically increases and decreases.

The sinusoidal function h models the measure of the angle, in radians, formed by the pendulum and the vertical centerline as a function of time t, in seconds. A negative value of ht indicates the pendulum is to the left of the vertical centerline; a positive value of ht indicates the pendulum is to the right of the vertical centerline.

o.l: ​The range is positive real numbers.
​The range is positive integers.
​The range is values of the form 2.54+0.2x, where x is a nonnegative real number.
​The range is values of the form 2.54+0.2x, where x is a nonnegative integer.

q.s: ​The average rate of change of the quadratic function p is -4 on the interval 0≤x≤2 and -1 on the interval 2≤x≤4. What is the average rate of change of p on the interval 6≤x≤8 ?

o.l: ​2
​3
​5
​The average rate of change on the interval 6≤x≤8 cannot be determined from the information given.

q.s: In the xy-plane, two points are close together on the graph of an implicitly defined function. The graph includes these two points and a vertical line segment connecting them. Which of the following is true?

o.l: The rate of change of y with respect to x is positive on the portion of the graph between the two points.
The rate of change of x with respect to y is positive on the portion of the graph between the two points.
The rate of change of y with respect to x is 0 on the portion of the graph between the two points.
The rate of change of x with respect to y is 0 on the portion of the graph between the two points.

q.s: Which of the following statements is true about the model and the estimates produced by the model that correspond to  A  and B ?

o.l: The model produces an overestimate at A and an underestimate at B. Based on the absolute values of the residuals, there is a greater error in the model with B than with A.
The model produces an underestimate at A and an overestimate at B. Based on the absolute values of the residuals, there is a greater error in the model with B than with A.
The model produces an overestimate at A and an underestimate at B. Based on the absolute values of the residuals, there is a greater error in the model with A than with B.
The model produces an underestimate at A and an overestimate at B. Based on the absolute values of the residuals, there is a greater error in the model with A than with B.

f.c: A regression model S is constructed for a data set. The residuals from the regression are plotted and labeled. Based on the vertical axis of the residual plot (not shown), point A is located at 1.3 and point B is located at  - 2.5 .

q.s: Angelo’s and The Creamery are the two ice cream shops open every Saturday in a certain town. Based on survey data, the town determined that there is a 70% chance that a customer of Angelo’s will return to Angelo’s the following Saturday and a 30% chance that a customer of Angelo’s will go to The Creamery the following Saturday. There is also a 60% chance that a customer of The Creamery will return to The Creamery the following Saturday and a 40% chance that a a customer of The Creamery will go to Angelo’s the following Saturday. The constant ai gives the percent of customers who go to Angelo’s on a Saturday designated as the ith. The constant ci gives the percent of customers who go to The Creamery on a Saturday designated as the ith.  Matrix M is a 2×2 transition matrix that is used to model these changes between ice cream shops such that Mancn=an+1cn+1.  Which of the following defines M ?

o.l: 0.70.30.40.6
0.70.30.60.4
0.70.40.30.6
0.70.60.30.4
